Represents the address of the search result.
A ``NavigationRoute` object defines a single route that the user can follow to visit a series of waypoints in order.
The route object includes information about the route, such as its distance and expected travel time. Depending on
the criteria used to calculate the route, the route object may also include detailed turn-by-turn instructions.

A
object indicates a location along a route. It may be the route’s origin or destination, or it may be
another location that the route visits. A waypoint object indicates the location’s geographic location along with
other optional information, such as a name or the user’s direction approaching the waypoint.
